channel.title: My lil' no big skills :)
channel.description:
Something I made for fun:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kTAxQM2I8BY[/url]
Hope you people find it funny! (Lets not be grumpy!)
Oh and my first documentary:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FJtw4w-Z5Fs[/url] (was thinking if I should had posted this up)
And A MGS Movie trailer I made (but not involved in the actual project):
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5T75G6vNSf4[/url]
Also, here is my 3d Games Modelling work from 1st year of Uni. Im currently am in my 2nd year, assignments are getting harder!
![](upload://cRBnZVwFU9sboLuL4usvHfzW7ZH.jpeg)
[url]https://i14.photobucket.com/albums/a338/ali_fighter/room.jpg[/url]
[url]https://i14.photobucket.com/albums/a338/ali_fighter/king.jpg[/url]

item.description:
I made a trailer of MGS Movie. BUT I did not work on any of the video footage, all I did was re-compile them and take the audio from the game, so credit goes to those who actually filmed the sequences:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5T75G6vNSf4

The original trailer was in Japanese.

Hope you like it

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
To be honest, I like the original sound track more then the cinematic one. When I’m running full tilt into a battle I want to hear some fast energetic music, rather then a lot of the slow stuff that they have in there.
Of course, I only played version 3 and the first chapter and a half, so that may be different.

The way I envision half life is more of an action movie, and action movies have faster and heavier music then what FakeFactory is making half life into.

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: ali_f
item.description:
The following video is the Cinematic Mod 9.5 version of Episode 2’s ending (nothing changed, apart from skins/graphics and music).

SPOILER ALERT! DO NOT WATCH UNLESS YOU HAVE CLOCKED HL2 EPISODE 2! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mz0h4u7CyCg

For those who don’t like the skin etc. Put that complaint at the side since you CAN switch them off. What I like about the mod is the soundtrack used in some places in Episode 2. It makes it feel, well, more cinematic lol

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: ali_f
item.description:
The option is not in-game, but is available on a seperate application called ‘character pimper’. It’s really easy to use, so no problems there.

When you install fakefactory V9+, the skins are the HL2 by default.

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: w00ties
item.description:
ali_f:

Yup, the later versions offer you an option to turn the skins off.

That’s good. He does great work, but I don’t like the replacement models he offers. Maybe that’s just because I’ve already grown to love the Half-Life characters over the years as they are.

Is the option to toggle off his replacements in an ingame menu, or do we have to delete files out of the mod folder?

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
ali_f:

Yeah, the biggest problem with CM that it requires a 64 bit machine to run the game. This is mostly due to the excessive amount of RAM it needs. HOWEVER, I’ve heard recently that users with a 32bit machine can also play the mod too! The best place to really know is Fakefactory’s homepage etc.

I also agree its huge! But I just see it as like if I’m downloading a game through my steam account!

Actually I think you only need 64 bit to run it well.

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: ali_f
item.description:
Level:

Yeah, if you feel like downloading 10 GB of files. Jesus it’s huge.
Plus, from what I read, you need quite the system to run it.

Yeah, the biggest problem with CM that it requires a 64 bit machine to run the game. This is mostly due to the excessive amount of RAM it needs. HOWEVER, I’ve heard recently that users with a 32bit machine can also play the mod too! The best place to really know is Fakefactory’s homepage etc.

I also agree its huge! But I just see it as like if I’m downloading a game through my steam account!

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
ali_f:

Yeah, 9.5 was the first cinematic mod I tried out. I really liked the soundtrack (since being a fan of the Batman movies)!

To those who don’t like the models it offers, it is possible to toggle them to the originals etc.

Overall, Cinematic Mod is a good experience.

Yeah, if you feel like downloading 10 GB of files. Jesus it’s huge.
Plus, from what I read, you need quite the system to run it.

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: ali_f
item.description:
w00ties:

I knew they had CM9.5, but I thought it ended there. Glad he released another one. FakeFactory has been around for ages, everybody should try out some of his packs (either his cinematic mods or just his hi-def packs - both are great additions to HL2).

Yeah, 9.5 was the first cinematic mod I tried out. I really liked the soundtrack (since being a fan of the Batman movies)!

To those who don’t like the models it offers, it is possible to toggle them to the originals etc.

Overall, Cinematic Mod is a good experience.

Read full topic

item.title: My lil' no big skills :)
item.dc:creator: w00ties
item.description:
ali_f:

Gothic Alyx came from some mod made by a guy named ‘fakefactory’. The mod’s called: ‘Cinematic Mod’.

I found it recently! And now I heard a newer version is available:

SPOILER ALERT IN VIDEO! DO NOT WATCH UNLESS YOU CLOCKED HL2 AND IT’S EPISODES!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T9ve-RpGg4Y

“FakeFactory’s Cinematic Mod is a modification which adds high-resolution textures to nearly all of the objects in the original Half-Life 2. The mod replaces the original music with orchestral scores and also modifies weapon strength to resemble realistic stopping power.” - valve developer community.

PS: thanks for your comment

I knew they had CM9.5, but I thought it ended there. Glad he released another one. FakeFactory has been around for ages, everybody should try out some of his packs (either his cinematic mods or just his hi-def packs - both are great additions to HL2).

Read full topic
